briefTitle: Efficacy of Secukinumab Compared to Ustekinumab in Patients With Plaque-type Psoriasis
officialTitle: A 52-week, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind Study of Subcutaneous Secukinumab to Demonstrate Efficacy as Assessed by Psoriasis Area and Severity Index at 16 Weeks of Treatment Compared to Ustekinumab and to Assess Long-term Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis (CLEAR)
summary: This study assessed efficacy of secukinumab, compared to ustekinumab, in patients that have plaque-type psoriasis

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis Who Achieved Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) 90 at Week 16
